page.title: 17FARMING AROUND BEDWORTH
page.content: There are a lot of farms in our area. They are nearly all small.There are more meadow fields than intensive grass or ploughed fields,so most of the farms must have cows or other grass-eating animals.Two examples are Taff's & Sole End Farms.{ {TAFF'S FARM}is in Smorrall Lane, Bedworth.It has 124 acres of land. There are 200 beef,300 sheep,600 lambs & 10 goats.There are 2 men employed & the farmer has only been farming there 9 yrs.{ {SOLE END FARM}is in Astley Lane, Bedworth.It was first built in 1056.It was also mentioned in the first Domesday Book.There are 700 dairy cattle,800 sheep,1400 lambs & about 20 horses.They have got 500 acres of land & 4 men are employed.The farmer has farmed here for 30 yrs & the farm has been passed down through the family.
